title: A Reminder for Riot for Pre-Season 6
body:
Riot. You buffed AD items (which is completely fine), BUT you nerfed (more like made it more costly) all armor items. Why? 

In a situation like this, you NEED to BUFF armor items slightly or you need to buff up everyone's base armor excluding ADCS and {{champion:157}} especially._** Just remember this, try to fix any potential mistakes with the time you have now instead of waiting a whole patch of stupidity to go by.**_

replies.body:
I keep seeing this claim make its rounds. "AD items are buffed." No, they're not. They're rebalanced. Most of them give less AD. Less attack speed. More crit. A variety of life steal/spellvamp options, but no feasible way to stack them without sacrificing too much in other areas. Choices between flat arpen (beat squishies), % bonus arpen (beat fed tanks), and stacking armor shred (takes time or rapid hits). ADCs will be doing less damage, slower, and relying more on crit, which is an indirect buff to Randuin's Omen (and a nerf to their tower-taking power, which BY THE WAY got buffed for AP champions). BoRK got nerfed. Most defensive items with health now give more health.

Everyone's full build got more expensive, but lower tier items are cheaper and gold income is higher. The result is the build paths overall are much smoother no matter what your class or role. These changes aren't happening in a vacuum. You need to observe them in context to properly judge them.

to be honest tho i think supports got the biggest buff since everyone starts with an upgraded trinket.

I've been figuring this since the juggernaut items: They want you to buy more armor items and damage, so they're buffing MR so you don't have to buy as much, and simultaneously making armor items less efficient while offering more of them.
They nerfed the overall amount of AD in the game, nerfed the amount of AS, and nerfed armor pen substantially. The only thing that got buffed was crit.
